title: Assistant Director of Student Activities Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Richmond
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview. Each interviewer asked a question. Total time was 30 mins. I liked the interview it was positive and nice. Hope i will be invited back to the next round
Interview Questions: Panel interview. Each interviewer asked a question. Total time was 30 mins. I liked the interview it was positive and nice. Hope i will be invited back to the next round

title: Senior Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at University of Richmond
Interview Descriptions: There were 2 rounds of interviews, involving at least 10 different people who were on the team or directly worked with the team. It was a good chance to learn a lot about the overall culture and specific job duties of the position.
Interview Questions: There were a good number of technical questions, largely focusing on SQL.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Richmond
Interview Descriptions: 3 rounds, application submitted, first a phone call, then an in person interview. It was a great experience. In person interview consisted of an all day event. Met with several campus partners
Interview Questions: What relevant experience do you have?

title: Events Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Richmond
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very slow--they take awhile to get back to you and get the ball rolling. Once in the door, it went very smoothly, with a multi-step process (phone and in-person). Just expect for them to take awhile to review your initial application.
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult/potentially sensitive situations?

title: Content Writer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Richmond
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very in-depth. It began with several phone calls, one face to face,  and then culminated in a day-long series of interviews on campus.  Everyone was very nice, but it felt like overkill for the position.
Interview Questions: There was a lot of "tell us about yourself." Lots of non-specific open-ended questions that felt sort of awkward.

title: Social Media Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Richmond (Richmond, VA) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions:
The first step was a very quick 30-min phone interview with the Director and VP of the department. The second round was in person. 
The phone interview was so quick, I doubt they were really able to gather much information on me. I would have preferred Zoom so you could see how each other responded to certain questions and answers.
Interview Questions:
1. If you took this job, would you feel as though you were pigeon-holding yourself since you do more than just social media?
2. Tell us about a campaign you created that you are proud of.

title: Biz Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Richmond
Interview Descriptions: Very informative and detailed. The interview starts with general introductions, followed by domain space chat, information gathering followed by questions/answer. Overall it was a great experience.  They review your resume and be ready to share the documents.
Interview Questions: Prior experience in student data analytics.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Richmond
Interview Descriptions: standard flyout: meet with everyone in the department, and job market paper presentation. The building of school of business is a little bit complicated. The ppl here are super nice. But the office doesn't sort by department.
Interview Questions: Future pipeline

title: Orientation Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Richmond (Richmond, VA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: You submit your application and then have an in-person interview with one of the staff members and one of the student orientation leaders. They explain the position and ask you a few questions, the interview doesn't go over 20 minutes. It was a very simple process and not intimidating.
Interview Questions: If you saw a student being bullied in some way how would you intervene?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Richmond (Richmond, VA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Submitted an application on line; within the month was contacted for a phone interview.  First there is the phone interview; less than a week later, HR contacted me to invite me to campus and confirm my salary requirements and what they were willing to offer in the salary range.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?  Why did you apply for the position?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Richmond
Interview Descriptions: This really depends on the supervisor, but generally you would email the professor/supervisor expressing your interest in a position. Then, you'll set up an in-person meeting with the supervisor to discuss the position and your interests and qualifications just like in any other interview. Then, if he/she thinks you are a good candidate, you'll get the job probably on the spot or in a follow-up email.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this positions?

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Richmond
Interview Descriptions: The group interview is basically the start of training, they are desperate for more callers. If you apply you are more less guaranteed a position, but the job has a high burnout rate
Interview Questions: What would you say to a difficult donor

title: Student Technical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Richmond (Richmond, VA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. Job listings and descriptions are posted on university website. You submit resume on student job site to specified person mentioned, then they contact you for a brief interview (less than 30 minutes).
Interview Questions: What iOS experience do you have?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Richmond (Richmond, VA)
Interview Descriptions: very casual one on one interview for intern position. The office is run solely with student interns with 5-8 positions per year. each intern is responsible for their hired position but everyone is encouraged to assist each other. office work, meetings, and group work may be required.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself.

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Richmond
Interview Descriptions: I was first approached at a career and the hiring manager was very friendly. I was asked basic questions about my experience and how often I would be available to work.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience in an office setting?

title: CCE Community Based Learning Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Richmond (Richmond, VA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: A couple weeks after applying, I was contacted via email to set up a phone interview.  The phone interview went really well.  I sent a follow-up email to my interviewee.  A week or so later, I was contacted by HR to set up an in-person interview.  It was a three-part process.  First I met with HR, then a panel interview led by the same interviewee as the phone interview, and then a one-on-one meeting with the executive director of the center.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation at work that didn't go as planned and how you handled it.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Richmond
Interview Descriptions:
This is for Richmond College. 
There was an online application of a few paragraph-length questions. 
First there were group interviews of 2 activities, and then individual interviews with the deans office.
Interview Questions: Design your ideal dorm

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Richmond (Richmond, VA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was group interview that was more or less a stimulation of what you might experience on the job. Fairly straightforward, everyone in my interview was subsequently hired. There is high job turnover so they are constantly looking for people
Interview Questions: How would you respond to a difficult alumni?

title: Tutor Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Richmond (University of Richmond, VA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I contacted the Associate Director, sent him my resume, set up an interview, interviewed well, and was offered the job. Whole process took 3 days. There was no negotiation in salary.
Interview Questions: None, just talk about yourself

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Richmond (Richmond, VA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: In order to be considered for this position, an application must be submitted during the first few weeks of a semester.   Should a candidate be considered for a positionIn they will receive an email providings for an interview.  Candidates who can demonstrate fluency in the language to be taught are preferred.
Interview Questions: You are given a small booklet and are asked to present a short 3-5  lesson to a panel of professors.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Richmond (Richmond, VA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: A phone interview, followed by an in-person interview with 5 different people.  I met with several people, including one of my teammates, a Dean, some Faculty members, the business manager, and Human Resources.
Interview Questions: What is something that you have been given negative feedback on, and how did you respond?

title: Concierge Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Richmond (Richmond, VA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Ok, nothing of interest, not bad, not good. I don't know, they just gave me the job. the asked if I was interested and hired me. I don't know what else to say
Interview Questions: where have you worked before, what did you do, etc.

title: Associate Dean Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Richmond (Richmond, VA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: very professional - spoke with many people - felt that they were serious and clear about what they wanted in the position/person - they were thorough and had me speak with the dean, faculty and students as well
Interview Questions: they asked what I would bring to the job

title: Science Reading Room Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Richmond (Richmond, VA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: There was a form that you had to fill out. There was no formal interview for this position. Your boss is extremely kind and helpful. It was a wonderful position to work in and I absolutely loved it.
Interview Questions: What hours can you work?

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Richmond (Richmond, VA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Only one interview was conducted. It was a 1:1 interview lasting for two days. Not very exciting though. I was meeting a group of faculty members and was also dining with them. I had also to give a lecture on my understanding of the topic. At the end of the lecture, I answered questions.
Interview Questions: How many years have you worked on this position

title: Technical Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Richmond (Richmond, VA) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the position online at hr.richmond.edu. Received a callback from Human Resources about three weeks later to setup an interview. First was a phone interview with the Help Desk manager. Then there was an in person interview with the Help Desk manager. Following that was a technical interview with a panel from the Help Desk. Lastly there was an interview with the Assistant Vice President of User Services. I received a call from HR about a week later with an offer.
Interview Questions: N/A
